results.creator_credit: George McQuilkin, Churchill Films and Larry Stein

results.title: TV training: sound in television
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates the use of different kinds of microphones to record correct sound for television. It also shows how effective use of sound can create atmosphere.

results.title: TV sale
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Don Worobey, John Taylor, Peter Jones and Ernie Schmidt
results.brief_description: The opening pitch of the television salesman pretty well establishes the tone of this pithy animation film: a solid-state model guarantees high-quality entertainment. TV Sale is an entertaining, incisive and horrifying satire on some of the material that is disgorged via the “boob tube.” Programs are designed around the product, not the spectator.

results.title: TV news: behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: John Barnes, Randolph Hobler, Michael Livesey and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World of work”.
Follows one day’s preparation of an evening TV news broadcast at a major New York studio, showing how stories are assigned and reported, with examples of on the spot coverage. Concentrates on the editorial and technical teamwork involved in the selection and final preparation of news stories to be presented on air, with special emphasis on the contributions of key members of the newsroom staff. Narrated by John Barnes.

results.title: TV news at the conferences
results.brief_description: This is a case study on British politics and television, shot during the 1976 Labour and Conservative Party conferences held in Blackpool and Brighton respectively. Concentrates on the way the BBC news covered three events of these conferences - the Prime Minister’s speech at the Labour Conference, and Mr Heath’s and Mrs Thatcher’s speeches at the Conservative Conference. Narrated by Michael Smee.

results.title: TV news
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Media Probes”.
John Cameron Swayze, US television’s first national anchorman, examines how the drive for ratings has led to some dazzling newsroom packages. Highlights the notion of style in TV news programs and the image of the network for the audience, while touching briefly on the limitations of television as a news medium. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: TV miniatures
results.credit_line:
Designed by Graham McGuffie
Emily Boutard and Megafun
results.brief_description: These six miniature dioramas reflect how home interiors changed to make way for TV across different decades, representing the common places people watched their favourite stories unfold on-screen.

constellations_primary.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_primary.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

results.description: Television didn’t just change the way we see the world; it changed the look and layout of our homes. Since TV arrived in Australia in the 1950s, how and where we watch TV evolved alongside its form and function. These six miniature dioramas, designed by Graham McGuffie and handmade by Emily Boutard, reflect how home interiors changed to make way for TV across different decades, representing the common places people watched their favourite stories unfold on-screen.
description_for_label: Television didn’t just change the way we see the world; it changed the look and layout of our homes. Since TV arrived in Australia in the 1950s, how and where we watch TV evolved alongside its form and function. These six miniature dioramas, designed by Graham McGuffie and handmade by Emily Boutard, reflect how home interiors changed to make way for TV across different decades, representing the common places people watched their favourite stories unfold on-screen.

results.title: TV graphics: a training programme (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Centre for Educational Television Overseas and Muhip Babalik
results.brief_description: Outlines the main steps in the production of word captions, photo captions, simple animation for captions and other graphics for television. Good results are achieved not just by good layout and effective text but also by proper production techniques which ensure a good picture on the screen. Commentator: Tom Singleton.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Centre for Educational Television Overseas and Muhip Babalik
